isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - CAB ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - TESTING ELECTRIC WINDOW - RIGHT AND LEFT

svcproc.title: TESTING ELECTRIC WINDOW - RIGHT AND LEFT

entry.para: Do any of the windows operate from any control?
Does the left window operate correctly?
Does the right window operate correctly from both the passenger and driver control?
Right window operates correctly from both controls.
Remove 20A fuse F4-B and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Re-install fuse F4-B. Remove electric window relay from connector (1138). Measure voltage to ground at circuit 83.
Locate cause of no or low voltage, then repair.
At connector (1138) measure voltage between circuits 83 and 12-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 12-G to ground, then repair.
At connector (1138) measure voltage between circuits 12W and 12-G.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 12W, then repair.
Install relay in connector (1138). Turn key on. Measure voltage to ground at circuit 83D .
Remove driver side left window switch from connector (1039). Measure resistance from (1039) circuit 83H to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 83H or 83C, then repair.
Turn key on. Measure voltage to ground from (1039), circuit 83H.
Locate cause of no or low voltage on circuit 83H, then repair.
Measure voltage between (1039) circuit 83H and circuit 83-GBW.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 83-GBW, 83-GA or 11-GAW to ground, then repair.
With driver side left switch in up position measure resistance between switch terminals 2B and 4.
With switch in up position measure resistance between switch terminals 5B and 1.
With switch in down position measure resistance between terminals 1 and 2B.
With switch in down position measure resistance between terminals 4 and 5B.
Disconnect motor at connector (1044). At connector (1039) measure resistance from 83F and 83N to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 83F or 83N, then repair.
Connect (1039) to window switch. Turn key on. With switch in down position, at connector (1044) measure voltage to gnd. at circuit 83N.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 83N between connectors (1039) and (1044), then repair.
With switch in down position, at connector (1044) measure voltage between circuits 83N and 83F.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 83F between connectors (1039) and (1044), then repair.
Driver side left window control circuits check good. If window fails to operate, either the mechanical parts or the motor may be defective.
Remove driver's side right window switch from connector (1040). Measure resistance from (1040) circuit 83E to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 83E, then repair.
Turn key on. Measure voltage to ground from (1040), circuit 83E.
Locate cause of no or low voltage on circuit 83E, then repair.
Measure voltage between (1040) circuit 83E and circuit 83-GB.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 83-GB to ground, then repair.
With driver side right switch in neutral position measure resistance between switch terminals 1, 2B and 5B.
With switch in up position measure resistance between switch terminals 2B and 4.
With switch in up position measure resistance between switch terminals 5B and 1.
With switch in down position measure resistance between terminals 1 and 2B.
With switch in down position measure resistance between terminals 4 and 5B.
Measure resistance from connector (1040) circuit 83J and 83K to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 83J or 83K, then repair.
Install a jumper between (1040) circuit 83J and 83K. Remove pasenger's side window switch from connector (1041). Measure resistance between (1041) circuit 83J and 83K.
Locate open in circuit 83J or 83K, then repair.
Remove jumper from connector (1040) and reconnect driver side switch. Measure resistance from (1041) circuit 83D to ground.
Locate short to ground in circuit 83D, then repair.
Turn key on. Measure voltage from (1041) circuit 83D to ground.
Locate open in circuit 83D, then repair.
With passenger side switch in neutral position measure resistance between switch terminals 1and 2B.
With switch in neutral position measure resistance between switch terminals 6 and 5B.
With switch in up position measure resistance between switch terminals 2B and 4.
With switch in up position measure resistance between switch terminals 5B and 1.
With switch in down position measure resistance between terminals 1 and 2B.
With switch in down position measure resistance between terminals 4 and 5B.
Disconnect motor at connector (1045). At connector (1041) measure resistance to gnd. at circuit 83L.
Locate short to ground in circuit 83L, then repair.
At connector (1041) measure resistance from 83M to gnd.
Locate short to ground in circuit 83M, then repair.
Connect (1041) to window switch. Turn key on. With switch in down position, at connector (1045) measure voltage to gnd. at circuit 83M.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 83M between connectors (1041) and (1045), then repair.
With switch in down position, at connector (1045) measure voltage between circuits 83M and 83L.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 83L between connectors (1041) and (1045), then repair.
Right window control circuits check good. If window fails to operate, either the mechanical parts or the motor may be defective.
